meanings.definition: To move (a baby or young child) up and down in a playful or affectionate way.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys dandling her baby to make him giggle.
meanings.sent2: The mother was dandling her infant gently in her arms.
meanings.sent3: The father dandled the baby, making funny faces to entertain him.
meanings.sent4: The branches dandled in the wind, swaying back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The boat dandled on the calm waves, rocking gently.

meanings.definition: To pamper or indulge (someone) in a playful or affectionate manner.
meanings.sent1: He dandled his pet cat, giving her treats and cuddles.
meanings.sent2: The grandparents dandled their grandchild with love and attention.
meanings.sent3: The wealthy lady dandled her poodle, dressing it up in fancy outfits.
meanings.sent4: The chef dandled the dish with extra care, adding special ingredients.
meanings.sent5: The sun dandled the flowers with its warm rays, nurturing their growth.
